help.name: lta_diff
help.description: This program can compute different distance norms for a single transform or for the difference between two transforms. If only a single transform is passed, it is compared to identity.

positional.intro: The two transform files are positional arguments, the second one is optional.

optional-flagged.explanation: the following distance types are supported: 1 Rigid Trans. Dist. (||log(R)|| + ||T||) on D=M2*M1^(-1) 2 * Affine Transform Distance (RMS) on D=M2-M1 (r=100mm) 3 8-corners mean distance after transform 4 Max Displacement on Sphere 5 Determinant (scaling) on D = M1*M2 6 Interpolation Smoothing (only for first transform) 7 Decomposition of D= M1*M2 = Rot*Shear*Scaling (* default is 2) The Affine Trans. Dist. (RMS) is based on Jenkinson 99 RMS deviation tech report.
invert first transform before computing difference matrix D
invert second transform before computing difference matrix D
compute distance in vox coordinates (after adjusting for vox sizes). Default: work in RAS coordinates.
divide final distance by this (e.g. for step adjustment, this is usually not necessary)
in mm, use for RMS (dist 2), default 100 to include head
